website_summaries.verdict: Many people liked the Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 35. They welcomed the color schemes, the sturdiness of the engineered mesh, the comfortable underfoot platform, and the traction-ready outsole. Moreover, the versatility of this model was lauded. On the other hand, several consumers complained of an inconsistent fit, as well as a decline in the quality of the aesthetics via the midsole creasing.
pros: Many people liked the aesthetics of the Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 35, emphasizing the freshness of the color schemes
The zigzag stitching of the engineered mesh was appreciated because it kept the façade durable
A lot of testers welcomed the full-length Zoom Air unit, which responsibly cushioned the foot and attenuated impact shock
The grip capability of the outsole unit received praise from a lot of consumers
Based on several runners’ responses, the Pegasus 35 functioned well across a variety of activities like speed training, even-paced runs, and even half-marathons
Several wearers admired the overall design of the shoe
they said it is very comfortable
A few wearers mentioned that the shoe has a lightweight construction
The Pegasus 35 runs true to size, as mentioned in some user reviews
cons: A tester complained that the upper unit of the Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 35 was a bit wide and that it didn’t hug the foot securely
A few runners reported that the collar wasn’t too secure
the heel tended to slip off the shoe’s opening
The outer section of the midsole unit creased after a few uses, according to a tester
Such an occurrence supposedly diminished the visual flair of this model
The shoe is pricey compared to other road running shoes available in the market, said a few users

customer_reviews.title: Great road shoe - fast and cushioned.
customer_reviews.text: Great as an everyday road shoe. Good grip in the wet. These shoes are fast and as with my other Nike's really benefit from being driven rather than cruising. Reasonably well cushioned though not as well as say Brooks Glycerin. They need to be tied again after about a mile as they tend to come loose. A bit sloppy on the heel without lacing through the second hole. Overall a good shoe for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Charley S

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow trainer and get a half size or full size bigger if you are a male.
customer_reviews.text: Trainers look great. Normally a size 8 UK fits me fine I suggest getting a half size or full size bigger these are a narrow trainer .i have had 100 s of pairs of nike over the years.but these were the biggest waste of money to date for me. I don't have particularly wide feet.the only thing I can think is that these are a woman's trainer.and design is not as a man's would be.after 2 days of wearing I hav knee pain.so now these trainers will be redundant.saying that I do suffer knee pain any way but these amplified it within days.so be aware.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Low rise
customer_reviews.text: They are generally decent shoes but feel a little low rise at the heel. This means I have to tie them more tightly than I would normally like in order not to feel like my heels are slipping out slightly.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: I'm so convinced by the quality of these that I bought a 2nd pair. The reality is they have assisted with my performance no end, you just have to ensure you land the right size. As per my previous review, you'll probably need half a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the same size as always for Nikes. These were very short and narrow. Returned for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaPapaGolf

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trainer! I have used Brooks Ghost and also mizuno wave rider but the Nike’s are my favourite so far! Really comfortable to run in. Simple can’t fault them.
customer_reviews.author: J G Walne

customer_reviews.title: Very Narrow, Not like the old style
customer_reviews.text: I have the old version of these trainers which fit perfectly. these on the other hand are very narrow, could be down to the material but they hurt my feet when I exercise
customer_reviews.author: Rt

customer_reviews.title: Nike Pegasus Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I used various Nike Pegasus running shoes, I like them. They are one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Goran

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Just started this running malarkey, Got to say tho these running shoes are spot on nice tight fit and when used with the 1000 miles socks, fantastic. I am preparing for a 50 mile run so these are exactly what i needed :)
customer_reviews.author: Mo Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Great for fast running
customer_reviews.text: I found these too stiff/firm for daily trainers or any kind of long distance running (prefer Nike Zoom Elite 9/10 and Adidas Solar Boost). But for sprinting/fast intervals on the track (for me around 3min/km) they work excellently and surprised me, really responding much more to higher speed and providing great stability. Tongue is a bit long and the heel fits a bit loosely for me (seems a bit of overt design) but think I've found excellent 'fast shoes' when I was expecting these to be more long training-type shoes.
customer_reviews.author: EdLondon
